title: HAL, Cochin Shipyard, other defence stocks rise on govt's 15-year defence roadmap
content: The shares of some defence companies rose on September 8 as the 15-year defence modernisation plan announced by the Defence Ministry on September 5 boosted investor sentiment. Nifty India Defence index rose more than half a percent to hover around 7,559 in the afternoon. The index has snapped a two-day losing streak. The Indian Defence Ministry has laid out a 15-year roadmap for the industry, which outlines the needs for India's armed forces in the future. "As the nation stands on the threshold of embracing greater challenges and responsibilities in the forthcoming decades, it is but imperative that the Services be equipped accordingly," said the defence ministry's 2025 roadmap. "Greater private-public sector partnership is thus the road ahead,” it added, while noting the need for at least 10 nuclear propulsion systems to support the carrier and other future warships. India aims to have 62 Rafale jets in service by 2030, including 36 for the air force that started arriving in 2020. Currently, the carriers deploy a fleet of Soviet-origin MiG-29K. The roadmap also expects India to procure two electromagnetic aircraft launch systems and next-gen tanks. For missiles, the ministry is looking to procure forth-fifth gen Anti-Tank Guided Missile (ATGM), air-to-air missile systems and more, CNBC-TV18 reported. All defence players stand to benefit after the final procurements are approved by the government, the news channel said. The shares of defence companies were trading in the green on September 8. Cyient DLM shares rallied nearly 7 percent, while Data Patterns shares were up around 2.5 percent. Cochin Shipyard and Hindustan Aeronautics (HAL) shares were up around 1 percent, while Solar Industries and Bharat Electronics (BEL) shares were up more than 0.6 percent each. Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders, BEML and Bharat Dynamics (BDL) shares were trading in the green with marginal gains. Bucking the trend, Paras Defence shares dropped over 1.5 percent, while Garden Reach Shipbuilders & Engineers (GRSE) shares were down around 1 percent. title: HDFC Asset Management Company shares rise 2.04% in Monday's session
content: Shares of HDFC Asset Management Company gained 2.04% to trade at Rs 5,686.00 in Monday's session. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, the company's consolidated quarterly revenue has shown consistent growth. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 775.24 Crore, which increased to Rs 887.21 Crore for the quarter-ending September 2024. It further rose to Rs 934.63 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024 and remained robust at Rs 901.36 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The latest quarter, ending June 2025, saw revenue climb to Rs 968.15 Crore. Net profit figures also reflect a positive trend. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2024 stood at Rs 603.76 Crore, slightly decreasing to Rs 576.61 Crore in the September 2024 quarter. However, it recovered to Rs 641.36 Crore in the December 2024 quarter and remained strong at Rs 638.46 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The most recent quarter, ending June 2025, reported a net profit of Rs 747.55 Crore. The company's earnings per share (EPS) have followed a similar pattern. EPS was Rs 28.28 for the quarter-ending June 2024, Rs 26.99 for the quarter-ending September 2024, Rs 30.02 for the quarter-ending December 2024, and Rs 29.87 for the quarter-ending March 2025. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 34.95.Financials (Consolidated Quarterly)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 775.24 CroreRs 887.21 CroreRs 934.63 CroreRs 901.36 CroreRs 968.15 CroreNet ProfitRs 603.76 CroreRs 576.61 CroreRs 641.36 CroreRs 638.46 CroreRs 747.55 CroreEPS28.2826.9930.0229.8734.95The consolidated yearly financial performance shows consistent growth across key metrics. Revenue increased from Rs 2,166.81 Crore in 2023 to Rs 2,584.37 Crore in 2024, and further to Rs 3,498.44 Crore in 2025. Net profit also rose steadily, from Rs 1,423.37 Crore in 2023 to Rs 1,942.69 Crore in 2024, and reached Rs 2,460.19 Crore in 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) followed the same trend, growing from Rs 66.72 in 2023 to Rs 91.00 in 2024, and then to Rs 115.16 in 2025. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) increased from Rs 286.19 in 2023 to Rs 331.41 in 2024, and further to Rs 380.26 in 2025. The Return on Equity (ROE) also improved, from 23.30% in 2023 to 27.45% in 2024, and reached 30.26% in 2025. The company maintained a Debt-to-Equity ratio of 0.00 across all three years.Financials (Consolidated Yearly)202320242025RevenueRs 2,166.81 CroreRs 2,584.37 CroreRs 3,498.44 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,423.37 CroreRs 1,942.69 CroreRs 2,460.19 CroreEPS66.7291.00115.16BVPS286.19331.41380.26ROE23.3027.4530.26Debt to Equity0.000.000.00Income Statement (Consolidated Yearly)Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023SalesRs 3,498 CroreRs 2,584 CroreRs 2,166 CroreOther IncomeRs 561 CroreRs 579 CroreRs 315 CroreTotal IncomeRs 4,060 CroreRs 3,163 CroreRs 2,482 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 765 CroreRs 679 CroreRs 602 CroreEBITRs 3,294 CroreRs 2,484 CroreRs 1,879 CroreInterestRs 9 CroreRs 9 CroreRs 9 CroreTaxRs 825 CroreRs 532 CroreRs 446 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,460 CroreRs 1,942 CroreRs 1,423 CroreKey financial ratios indicate a P/E ratio of 34.85 and a P/B ratio of 10.55 as of March 2025. The company’s debt-to-equity ratio remained at 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 90 per share (1800%) on April 17, 2025, with an effective date of June 06, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates bullish sentiment on the stock as of September 08, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 5,686.00, HDFC Asset Management Company has seen a rise of 2.04% in Monday's session.

title: NLC India shares jump 3.03% amid volume surge; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of NLC India were trading with a gain of 3.03%, with the stock currently priced at Rs 235.45 in Monday's session, driven by high volume. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 1:56 pm. NLC India's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,825.61 Crore, compared to Rs 3,376.05 Crore in June 2024, marking an increase. The net profit for the same period was Rs 839.15 Crore, up from Rs 566.64 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) stood at Rs 5.02 in June 2025, similar to Rs 5.02 in June 2024. The consolidated yearly income statement shows a revenue of Rs 15,282.96 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 12,999.03 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 2,713.37 Crore, up from Rs 1,867.32 Crore. The EPS increased from Rs 13.47 in March 2024 to Rs 19.57 in March 2025. Key financial figures from the consolidated yearly income statement are presented below:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 15,282 CroreRs 12,999 CroreRs 16,165 CroreRs 11,947 CroreRs 9,846 CroreOther IncomeRs 1,606 CroreRs 947 CroreRs 1,217 CroreRs 598 CroreRs 1,952 CroreTotal IncomeRs 16,889 CroreRs 13,946 CroreRs 17,383 CroreRs 12,545 CroreRs 11,798 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 12,260 CroreRs 10,215 CroreRs 14,315 CroreRs 8,959 CroreRs 8,231 CroreEBITRs 4,628 CroreRs 3,730 CroreRs 3,067 CroreRs 3,586 CroreRs 3,566 CroreInterestRs 931 CroreRs 849 CroreRs 1,011 CroreRs 983 CroreRs 1,312 CroreTaxRs 983 CroreRs 1,014 CroreRs 630 CroreRs 1,488 CroreRs 909 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,713 CroreRs 1,867 CroreRs 1,425 CroreRs 1,115 CroreRs 1,345 CroreThe company’s cash flow from operating activities for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 9,043 Crore. The cash flow from investing activities was -Rs 7,159 Crore, and the cash flow from financing activities was -Rs 2,196 Crore. The balance sheet shows that the total liabilities as of March 2025 stood at Rs 57,851 Crore, with total assets at Rs 57,851 Crore. Key ratios include a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.20 and a current ratio of 0.72 as of March 2025. NLC India announced a final dividend of Rs 1.50 per share, with an effective date of September 19, 2025. The company's 69th Annual General Meeting is scheduled for September 27, 2025, via video conferencing. Moneycontrol analysis, as of September 2, 2025, suggests a bearish sentiment on the stock. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 235.45, NLC India has seen a surge of 3.03% in today's session amid high volume, also the stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index.

title: GVK Power & Infra AGM to be held on Sept 30, 2025
content: GVK Power & Infrastructure (GVKPIL) will convene its 31st Annual General Meeting (AGM) on September 30, 2025, to address multiple business matters. The meeting will take place via Video Conferencing (VC) at 11:30 AM, with the registered office in Secunderabad serving as the designated venue. Key AGM details are as follows:AGM Date and Time: Tuesday, September 30, 2025, at 11:30 AMVenue: Conducted via Video Conferencing (VC), registered office as deemed locationBook Closure Dates: From Saturday, September 27, 2025, to Tuesday, September 30, 2025 (inclusive)Equity Share Listing: National Stock Exchange of India Limited (NSE) and Bombay Stock Exchange Limited (BSE)Stock Codes: BSE: 532708, NSE: GVKPIL, ISIN: INE251H01024Registrar & Share Transfer Agents: KFin Technologies LimitedFinancial Performance: Consolidated total income for the year reached ₹802.16 Crores, compared to ₹1,080.14 Crores the previous year. Net profit after tax, share of profit from associate, share of profit from joint venture, exceptional items and non-controlling interest amounted to ₹5.98 Crores, up from ₹2.11 Crores the year prior. Financial Position:Fixed Assets (Net of depreciation): ₹3,290.69 CroresCash and Bank balance: ₹351.85 CroresNet current assets: ₹-218.96 CroresTotal Assets: ₹5,169.06 CroresAdditional Information:The 31st AGM has been scheduled for September 30, 2025.The meeting format is video conferencing.Book closure: September 27, 2025 – September 30, 2025.GVKPIL is listed on both NSE and BSE.KFin Technologies Limited manages share transfers.Currently, the Resolution Professional manages the company as per the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code and SEBI Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements (LODR) Regulations during the Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP) period.

title: Coromandel International shares fall 2.08% in today's session
content: Coromandel International shares experienced a decline of 2.08% to Rs 2,211.00 in Monday's session. The stock is part of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On August 30, 2025, Coromandel International announced a newspaper publication under Regulation 30 (LODR) regarding a notice of a special window for re-lodgement of transfer requests of physical shares. The company also announced an intimation under Regulation 30 read with Regulation 31(A)(8) of SEBI (LODR), 2015, following receipt of a request for de-classification from a promoter. The company announced a credit rating under Regulation 30 (LODR) on August 23, 2025. The company has announced multiple dividends. A final dividend of Rs 6 per share and a special dividend of Rs 3 per share were announced on May 1, 2025, both with an effective date of July 17, 2025. An interim dividend of Rs 6 per share was announced on January 31, 2025, with an effective date of February 5, 2025. Coromandel International had a stock split where the face value changed from Rs 2 to Rs 1 on December 23, 2010. Another stock split occurred on January 2, 2006, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 2. The company's consolidated financials show consistent performance. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 7,042.30 Crore, compared to Rs 4,728.83 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 501.63 Crore, up from Rs 324.67 Crore. title: Larsen & Toubro share price trades flat; touches day's high of Rs 3,579.90
content: Larsen & Toubro shares were trading nearly flat in Monday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 3,551.10, a marginal decline of 0.07% from the previous close. title: JSW Steel shares among top gainers on Nifty 50; rise 3.28%
content: Shares of JSW Steel were trading up by 3.28%, at Rs 1,108.30 in Monday's session, positioning it as one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50. Similarly, other stocks also saw gains, with M&M up by 3.19% at Rs 3,674.90, Tata Motors gaining 3.11% to Rs 713.20, Bajaj Auto up by 2.56% at Rs 9,317.00, and Hero Motocorp increasing by 2.55% to Rs 5,500.00 at 1:30 PM. The revenue for JSW Steel has shown some fluctuations in its quarterly results. The revenue for the quarter ending June 2024 was Rs 42,943.00 Crore, which decreased to Rs 39,684.00 Crore for the quarter ending September 2024. It then increased to Rs 41,378.00 Crore and Rs 44,819.00 Crore for the quarters ending December 2024 and March 2025, respectively. For the quarter ending June 2025, the revenue was Rs 43,147.00 Crore. The net profit also varied, with Rs 879.00 Crore for June 2024, Rs 466.00 Crore for September 2024, Rs 713.00 Crore for December 2024, Rs 1,744.00 Crore for March 2025, and Rs 2,309.00 Crore for June 2025. The earnings per share (EPS) followed a similar trend, with values of 3.47, 1.80, 2.94, 6.15, and 8.95 for the same respective quarters. The yearly consolidated financial data indicates fluctuations in revenue and net profit. Revenue was Rs 79,839.00 Crore in 2021, which increased to Rs 146,371.00 Crore in 2022 and Rs 165,960.00 Crore in 2023. It further rose to Rs 175,006.00 Crore in 2024 but decreased to Rs 168,824.00 Crore in 2025. Net profit was Rs 7,872.00 Crore in 2021, jumped to Rs 20,021.00 Crore in 2022, then decreased to Rs 4,276.00 Crore in 2023, increased to Rs 9,145.00 Crore in 2024, and again decreased to Rs 3,802.00 Crore in 2025. The EPS also varied, with values of 32.91, 85.96, 17.25, 36.34, and 14.36 for the same years, respectively. Key financial ratios for JSW Steel reveal a P/E ratio of 74.04 and a P/B ratio of 4.08. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.21 as of the year-ending March 2025. JSW Steel has announced several corporate actions, including newspaper publications regarding the initiation of the "Saksham Niveshak" campaign by IEPFA, updates on the APJSW Private Limited joint venture, and analyst/investor meet intimations. The company has a history of dividend payouts. The dividend declared on May 23, 2025, was a final dividend of Rs 2.80 per share (280%). Earlier dividends include Rs 7.30 per share (730%) on May 21, 2024, Rs 3.40 per share (340%) on May 22, 2023, Rs 17.35 per share (1735%) on May 27, 2022 and Rs 6.50 per share (650%) on May 21, 2021. With JSW Steel's last traded price at Rs 1,108.30, the stock has seen positive momentum during today's trading session, with its position as one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index.

title: Buy Samvardhana Motherson International; target of Rs 120: Emkay Global Financial
content: Emkay Global Financial' research report on Samvardhana Motherson International We attended SAMIL’s analyst meet, where it laid out a bold and transformative roadmap over FY25-30. KTAs: 1) Having outperformed the auto industry 2.5x faster in last 5Y, SAMIL has set its sight on USD108bn revenue (4x vs USD25.7bn in FY25) and 40% ROCE by FY30. 2) SAMIL has strategically seeded several emerging businesses (aerospace, consumer electronics, etc) in the last 5Y, positioning itself to capture global opportunities. 3) SAMIL has prioritized emerging market greenfields in last 5Y (mainly India) and is further sharpening its India emphasis. 4) SAMIL has been hand-picked by one of the largest global consumer electronics brands, entrusting it to develop the electronics ecosystem in India with a multibillion-dollar orderbook and profitable operations from Day 1. 5) SAMIL has built one of India’s fastest growing aerospace businesses (+USD1bn orderbook; only Indian exporter to Japan) despite its recent entry, thus cementing a path for accelerated growth up the value chain, also via strategic M&A (France-based AD Industries for propulsion systems). 6) Graduating from basic components to integrated assemblies, SAMIL aims for full car assembly by FY30. 7) Chinese OEMs are spreading wings globally and SAMIL intends capturing this opportunity by leveraging its dominant global manufacturing presence. 8) The mgmt also hinted at potential independent listing of certain businesses upon maturity. Outlook We believe that over next 5Y, newer businesses (esp consumer electronics) and its India focus would drive a major delta in SAMIL’s growth trajectory. We retain BUY; TP unchanged at Rs120. title: Hold Cipla; target of Rs 1570: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on Cipla In Q1FY26, the revenue grew marginally by 3.9% YoY (+3.4% QoQ) to INR 69,575 Mn., stood below our estimates (-3.1%), majorly led by weakness observed in North America and slower traction across India. The revenue growth was majorly driven by double-digit growth across the One Africa, Emerging markets and Europe vertical, partially offset by a decline in the North America vertical. Outlook We have rolled forward our valuation basis to Jun’27 estimates. We value Cipla at 23.5x Jun’27 EPS, implying a target price of INR 1,570. The stock is currently trading at 24.4x/23.6x on our FY26E/FY27E EPS estimates. We downgrade our rating from “ACCUMULATE” to “HOLD” on the stock, as we believe that ramp-down of Revlimid in the US portfolio will weigh on the future growth of the Company. title: Ujjivan Small Finance targets Rs 1 trillion loan book by FY30, stocks soar 3 percent
content: Ujjivan Small Finance Bank has shared a strategic roadmap to target a Rs 1 lakh crore loan book by FY30, an exchange filing by the SFB said, sending the shares sharply higher by over 3 percent on September 8. The lender added that it does not see any immediate need for raising capital, and aims to ramp up the secured loan book to 65-70 percent with CASA at 35 percent of its term deposits. This growth will be supported by an expansion of the bank's branch network from 752 to nearly 1,150 branches, Ujjivan said, adding that it aims to increase cross-selling to its customer base, including offerings such as IPO-ASBA, insurance, mutual fund distribution, remittances and co-branded credit cards. Sanjeev Nautiyal, Managing Director & CEO, Ujjivan Small Finance Bank said, "Our roadmap to a Rs 1 lakh crore gross loan book by FY30 builds on the foundation established since becoming a small finance bank. Over this period, we have grown our gross loan book from Rs 7,560 crore in FY17 to Rs 33,287 crore in Q1FY26." In five years, the SFB sees its average liability per branch to nearly double from Rs 51 crore to around Rs 102 crore. The lender said aims to widen and build its secured loan book portfolio to nearly 65-70 percent. "Ujjivan has been gradually diversifying its loan portfolio with secured lending increasing from 16 percent in FY19 to 46 percent as on Q1FY26. The bank aims to raise the share of its secured loan book to approximately 65-70 percent, led by growth in Affordable Housing, Micro Mortgages, MSME lending, Vehicle Finance, Gold Loans and Agri Loans," the SFB said in a statement. "The shift in asset book towards secured loans with lower risk weights not only enhances capital efficiency but also provides headroom to support long-term growth without immediate need for raising capital," the lender said. Ujjivan said it now has a 'granular liability franchise' with retail deposits (CASA and retail deposits) forming 72 percent of the total deposit base of Rs 38,619 crore as of Q1FY26. The CASA balance stood at Rs 9,381 crore, which is 24.3 percent its total deposits, and the lender said it plan to take this to 35 percent of the total deposits by FY30, with Net Interest Margin (NIM) seen around 6-7 percent by FY30. Additionally, the SFB is targetting to widen its product offering by adding solutions in the mid-corporate lending space, underscoring its reliance on micro banking portfolio of group loans, which is the foundation, with customers graduating to individual loans. With an aim of profitable growth, the bank has committed to focus on optimising its digital stack, right-sizing the employee count and operational expenses. The SFB is hopeful of enhanced productivity and a 'prudent' rollout of branch and physical infrastructure. "These will enable us to bring our cost to income ratio close to 55%. Combining this with our credit underwriting and collections mechanism will help deliver RoA of 1.8%-2.0% through prudent leverage and RoE of 16-18 percent by FY30," Ujjivan SFB said. On a YTD basis, shares of Ujjivan Small Finance Bank are higher by 28 percent. The lender added that it remains comfortably capitalized as of Q1FY26.

title: SpiceJet shares drop 5% after airline swings into red in Q1 with Rs 234-crore net loss
content: The shares of SpiceJet dropped more than 5 percent on September 8 after the airline reported a consolidated net loss of Rs 233.85 crore for the first quarter of the financial year 2026, as against a net profit of Rs 158.3 crore in the same period last year. The company released its results for the April-June quarter in the post market hours of September 5. The airline's revenue from operations meanwhile dropped around 34 percent year-on-year to Rs 1,120.2 crore during Q1 FY26. It had reported revenue from operations at Rs 1,708.2 crore in Q1 FY25. Passenger revenue per available seat kilometre (PAX RASK) stood at Rs 4.74 during the quarter. Passenger load factor (PLF) meanwhile was reported at 86 percent. Elara Capital cut its target price for the stock by more than 37 percent to Rs 39 per share after the release of the results, while maintaining its 'Accumulate' rating. The latest target price implies an upside potential of nearly 13 percent over the previous closing price. "A significant uptick in fleet size is awaited for growth. We trim our FY26E EPS estimates to negative INR 8.1 from INR 10.2 profit previously. We introduce FY27E and FY28E EPS at INR 0.4 and INR 1.4, assuming a decline in CASK to INR 4.7 by FY27E/28E from INR 5.4 in FY26E. We assume RASK during FY26E-28E at INR 5.2-5.4 and 41% passenger CAGR in FY25-28E due to fleet growth to 52 from ~20 currently,” the domestic brokerage said. Speaking about the net loss, SpiceJet said that it was impacted by costs related to grounded aircraft and expenses towards their return to service. It however added that its net worth position strengthened significantly, rising to Rs 446 crore during the quarter under review, as compared to the earlier deficit of Rs 2,398 crore in Q1 FY25. "The results were significantly impacted by geo‐political situation with a neighbouring country and airspace restrictions in key markets, which led to subdued leisure travel demand," SpiceJet said. Ajay Singh, Chairman and Managing Director of SpiceJet, said, "This quarter’s results reflect the extraordinary challenges faced by the aviation industry, including geopolitical turbulence, restricted air routes, and supply chain disruptions. Despite these headwinds, SpiceJet continues to demonstrate resilience. We are taking decisive steps to enhance fleet reliability, reduce costs, and expand our network. With India’s aviation and tourism sectors among the fastest‐growing globally, we remain confident of a strong recovery trajectory in the coming quarters." Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates SpiceJet shares later recovered some losses and were trading over 2 percent lower at Rs 33.62 apiece. This came after the company in an exchange filing announced that it has completed the full payment of $24 Million to Credit Suisse, thereby fulfilling in entirety the terms of the settlement agreement signed between the two parties in May 2022. The stock has fallen around 8 percent in the past five days, and around 33 percent in the past six months. The shares of the airline have declined more than 41 percent in the past one year. title: Pennar Industries Appoints Secretarial Auditor, AGM on Sept 30
content: Pennar Industries has announced the appointment of Mr. Subhash Kishan Kandrapu as the Secretarial Auditor of the company for five consecutive financial years, commencing from 2025-26 to 2029-30, effective after the upcoming AGM. The decision was made during a board meeting on September 8, 2025, in compliance with Section 204 of the Companies Act, 2013, and Regulation 24A of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations 2015. Mr. Subhash Kishan Kandrapu is a Practicing Company Secretary with Membership No. 32743 and Practicing No. 17545. The board is authorized to fix his remuneration between ₹1.5 lakh and ₹2.0 lakhs periodically. The board also approved the following:Ratification of remuneration payable to M/s. Kandikonda & Associates, Cost Accountants (Registration No. 101361) for the financial year ending March 31, 2026.Creation of charges.Authority to borrow in excess of paid-up capital and free reserves, up to ₹2,250 crores.Approval of Investments / Loans / Guarantees / Securities, up to ₹1,000 Crores.The 49th Annual General Meeting (AGM) will be held on Tuesday, September 30, 2025, at 11:00 A.M. via Video Conferencing (VC) / Other Audio Visual Means (OAVM). Wednesday, September 24, 2025, is the cut-off date for determining members eligible to vote on the resolutions. The remote e-Voting period will commence on September 26, 2025 (9:00 a.m.) and end on September 29, 2025 (5:00 p.m.). The results of the electronic voting will be declared to the Stock Exchanges after the AGM and will be available on the company's website along with the Scrutinizer's Report. Key appointments made by the board:Mr. Aditya Rao (DIN: 01317343) re-appointed as a Director, liable to retire by rotation.Mr. Subhash Kishan Kandrapu appointed as Secretarial Auditor.The board recommends the resolutions for approval. The 49th Annual General Meeting (AGM) of the members of the company will be held on Tuesday, the 30th September, 2025 at 11:00 A.M. through Video Conferencing (VC) / Other Audio Visual Means (OAVM).

title: Accumulate Navin Fluorine International; target of Rs 5075: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on Navin Fluorine International Navin Fluorine Q1FY26 revenue grew at a healthy pace of 38.5% YoY (+3.5% QoQ) to INR 7,254 Mn., in-line with our estimates (+1.6%). The growth was led by sustained momentum in the High-Performance Products (HPP) segment, with incremental support from Specialty Chemicals and CDMO. On a sequential basis, HPP delivered strong growth of 24.8%, while softness persisted in Specialty Chemicals (-15.4% QoQ) and CDMO (-13.9% QoQ), tempering the overall revenue uptick. Outlook We roll forward our valuation basis to Jun’27. We value Navin Fluorine at a 42.0x Jun’27 EPS, implying a target price of INR 5,075. We reiterate our “ACCUMULATE” rating on the stock, reflecting continued momentum across HPP, Specialty Chemicals, and CDMO segments. title: Buy Samvardhana Motherson; target of Rs 114: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Samvardhana Motherson We attended the SAMIL Analyst Meet, where management elaborated on its Vision 2030 targets. Its key performance highlights over the past five years include: 1) 3x growth in EBIT and 4.7x growth in PAT; 2) RoCE improved to 18.4% from 10.5% in FY20; and 3) net debt/EBITDA stands at 0.9x (the lowest in a decade). While SAMIL has fallen short of its five-year target, its performance remains commendable when viewed in the context of the significant headwinds faced during this period. The company has set a revenue target of USD108b for FY30, with other parameters expected to remain stable. In its core business, SAMIL aims to leverage synergies from 23 recent acquisitions and turn around 70 red units inherited through these acquisitions. Outlook Hence, despite the global headwinds, reiterate our Buy rating on SAMIL with a TP of INR114 (based on 24x June-27E EPS) given its significant growth opportunities going forward. title: Avanti Feeds, Gokaldas Exports, other shrimp and textile stocks jump up to 5%: Here's why
content: The shares of export-oriented shrimp feed and textile companies rose on September 8, buoyed by multiple factors. This comes following strong volatility after Donald Trump-led US administration increased tariffs on Indian imports to a whopping 50 percent. Pearl Global Industries shares surged more than 5 percent to trade at Rs 1,268 apiece, while KPR Mill shares gained around 2 percent. Gokaldas Exports shares jumped nearly 4 percent, while Vardhman Textiles shares were up over 1 percent. Avanti Feeds shares jumped more than 2 percent, while Apex Frozen Foods shares were up around 1 percent. Coastal Corp shares gained nearly 3 percent, while Waterbase shares were up more than 2 percent. Here are the likely triggers for the uptick in the share prices. Trump softens stance on India: United States President Donald Trump recently described India-US ties as a "very special relationship", adding that he would "always be friends" with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "I will always be friends with (Narendra) Modi… He is a great prime minister. He is great. But I just don't like what he is doing at this particular moment. But India and the United States have a special relationship. There is nothing to worry about. We just have moments on occasion," Trump said in the Oval Office on September 5. Speaking on the massive tariffs imposed on India, Trump said, "We put a very big tariff on India- 50 per cent, a very high tariff. I get along very well with (PM) Modi, as you know. He was here a couple of months ago, in fact, we went to the Rose Garden and had a press conference." PM Narendra Modi on September 6 said he deeply appreciated and fully reciprocated US President Donald Trump's positive assessment of India-US ties. Modi stressed that the two countries share a very positive and forward-looking Comprehensive and Global Strategic Partnership. The exchange came days after Modi met Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping at the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Tianjin. Following the meet, Trump wrote that the US had "lost Russia and India to deepest, darkest China". FM Sitharaman promises support: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the Centre is preparing a relief package to help exporters bear the impact of the steep 50 percent tariffs imposed by US President Donald Trump. "We cannot leave our exporters high and dry saying the situation will change sooner, we will work with them," Sitharaman said in in an interview to Network 18 Group Editor-In-Chief Rahul Joshi on September 5. She added that the package, awaiting Cabinet approval, will support industries hit hardest by the duties, as suddenly finding new markets is challenging. Indian exporters to lobby RBI for weaker rupee to offset US tariffs: Several Indian exporters are set to request RBI to allow them to temporarily convert proceeds from their US business at a rupee rate that is 15 percent lower than current levels, Bloomberg reported. This will help cushion some of the impact from the US tariffs. The businesses will make their case to RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra at a meeting next week, the report cited Engineering Export Promotion Council of India Chairman Pankaj Chadha as saying. They are facing a loss of about 30 percent in US-bound shipments because of the higher tariffs, and they want the government to shoulder at least half of the burden, he added. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Buy Ellenbarrie Industrial Gases; target of Rs 680: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Ellenbarrie Industrial Gases Ellenbarrie Industrial Gases (ELLEN), with a legacy of over five decades, is among the oldest industrial gas companies in India. The company manufactures and supplies a broad portfolio of gases, including oxygen, nitrogen, argon, hydrogen, helium and carbon dioxide. These gases are integral to essential systems and applications across industries such as steel, pharmaceuticals, healthcare, engineering, defense, energy, and food & beverages, supporting recurring demand and fostering long-term customer relationships. The company’s business model is underpinned by strong customer retention and high entry barriers, arising from the core nature of industrial gases and the structural rigidity of long-term pipeline contracts that limit supplier substitution. Outlook We expect a CAGR of 39%/49%/52% in revenue/EBITDA/PAT over FY25-28. ELLEN is currently trading at 49.8x/30.6x/25x FY26E/FY27E/FY28E PE. We initiate coverage on ELLEN with a BUY rating and a TP of INR680, based on ~40x FY27E EPS. title: Buy Affle 3i; target of Rs 2280: ICICI Direct
content: ICICI Direct's research report on Affle 3i We view Affle 3i (Affle) as a play on the structural shift of ad spend towards digital in India and other emerging markets, where digital penetration is still low versus global benchmarks. Its differentiated CPCU (cost per converted user) model directly aligns revenues with advertiser ROI, offering resilience versus impression-led peers. Over the medium term, we believe Affle could sustain ~20% revenue CAGR, supported by rising CPCU realisations, international expansion, and scaling of new verticals such as CTV. We estimate EBITDA margins to be resilient in the 22–24% range. Conversely, downside is limited by its strong operating cash flows, providing a balanced risk-reward profile. Outlook We initiate coverage on Affle with a BUY rating and a target price of INR 2,280. We think, at CMP, the reward-risk is skewed 2:1 in favour of BUY. title: Buy Vedanta; target of Rs 530: ICICI Direct
content: ICICI Direct's research report on Vedanta Vedanta (VEDL), with its bid amount of ~INR 170bn (staggered over 5 years), has reportedly (Link) emerged as the highest bidder for acquiring the assets of Jaiprakash Associate (JAL). We understand that VEDL needs to secure a few statutory approvals (CCI, NCLT, etc.), which we believe may take 3–6 months. Upon receiving the necessary approvals, VEDL would need to make an upfront payment of INR 37–38bn; payment of the balance shall be spread over the next five years thereon. Outlook The development is rather unexpected, since JAL’s businesses are non-core to VEDL’s current portfolio. At this juncture, we are note incorporating anything since we require further insights. We maintain BUY and our SoTP-based target price of INR 530. title: Buy Samvardhana Motherson International; target of Rs 115: ICICI Direct
content: ICICI Direct's research report on Samvardhana Motherson International Samvardhana Motherson International (SAMIL), at its analyst meet, presented its Vision 2030 where the company shared its aspiration to grow its gross revenue ~4x to USD 108bn over the next five years. Directionally, this may position Motherson group among top-3 auto ancillaries globally. Over the last two decades, Motherson group has expanded from a single-product/geography to a multi-products/geography auto component player and is now looking to replicate the same in newer segments (aerospace, consumer electronics, semiconductor, etc.). Playbook remains the same: higher content (premiumisation) + cross-selling + acquisitions. Outlook SAMIL is our preferred picks among large auto ancillaries. Its diversified business model and expanding product portfolio and customer base presents a multi-year growth and value-unlocking opportunity for investors. Maintain BUY with TP of INR 115, based on 20x FY27E EPS. title: Hold CEAT; target of Rs 3500: ICICI Direct
content: ICICI Direct's research report on CEAT In a deal valued at ~USD 225mn, CEAT has completed its acquisition of the CAMSO brand’s off-highway construction equipment-bias tyre and tracks business from Michelin. This opens the door for CEAT to a global customer base (40 OEMs and premium OHT distributors). Further, this now also complements CEAT’s existing portfolio to include tracks and construction-bias tires. In the transition phase, over the next 4–6 quarters, turnover/margin for CAMSO shall be lower, and turn EBITDA accretive post this period (high-teen margins expected). Outlook While medium-term prospects for CAMSO remain healthy, we remain vigilant towards potential near-term growth/margin vulnerabilities stemming from US-tariff. Retain HOLD; TP revised to INR 3,500 (vs. INR 3,750), based on 17x FY27E EPS. title: Shares of this smallcap stock rise nearly 50% in 3 sessions; here's why
content: Shares of a smallcap company MIC Electronics surged nearly 50 percent in the last three trading sessions amid high volumes. The stock rose nearly 19 percent to an intraday high of Rs 77.9 per share on the NSE. The share has been rising for the last three trading sessions and is up nearly 50 percent in the period. The stock had opened with a gain of 3.33 percent in today's trading session. A total of 3.35 crore shares changed hands today of the company until noon generating a total turnover of Rs 254.27 crore. The smallcap company has a market cap of Rs 1,856.27 crore, as per NSE website. MIC Electronics, founded in 1988, is engaged in designing, development, and manufacturing of light-emitting diode (LED) video displays and lighting products. The rally in the stock comes after the GST Council shifted to a two-slab system of 5% and 18%, removing the earlier 12% and 28% rates. title: Bharat Forge planning a defence complex to make missiles and space launch vehicles, sending shares higher
content: Shares of Bharat Forge are higher by over 5 percent to be among the top F&O gainer on September 8, as investors weighed its subsidiary's recent plan to buy a 950 -acre land parcel in Andhra Pradesh to develop a defence manufacturing complex. The step-down subsidiary, Agneyastra Energetics, is held through Kalyani Strategic Systems (KSSL), a wholly owned subsidiary of Bharat Forge. Agneyastra will purchase a nearly 949.65 acre land parcel in Madakasira, in Anantapur District, for undertaking development of 'End-to-End Defence Energetics Manufacturing Complex, including High Explosives Manufacturing plant, ammunition filling plant, gun propellant facility, and provisions for future expansioninto energetics for rockets, missile systems, space launch vehicles', Bharat Forge said in an exchange filing on September 4. India aims for Rs 3 lakh crore in defence production and Rs 50,000 crore in exports by 2029, setting the nation up as a reliable global defence partner, and Bharat Forge is leveraging on strategic partnerships and indigenous capabilities to increase its share in this business. During FY25, Bharat Forge received its biggest ever defence order worth nearly Rs 4,000 crore to supply 184 ATAGS platforms, marking what the company called a 'big moment for the private defence industry' in India, with private sector as a production partner. Its subsidiary Kalyani Strategic Systems (KSSL) has acquired a 25 percent stake in Italian design company EdgeLab, which specializes in design and manufacturing of Autonomous Underwater Vehicles. KSSL’s new manufacturing facility spread over 4 lakh square feet near Pune is slated to commence operations in H1FY26. In the near term, Bharat Forge said Q2FY26 looks a 'little weaker' driven by US exports, and the management hopes this will be the low for this cycle. "Second half should be better than the first half," Amit Kalyani said during the June quarter earnings call. "(In) aerospace, we will have strong growth in the year. Again, you have to look at it on a YOY basis. We should see upwards of 20% growth, maybe even higher than that," Amit Kalyani added.

title: Tata Motors shares gain 3.01%, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Tata Motors were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 in Monday's session, trading at Rs 712.55, a 3.01% increase. Other top gainers on the Nifty 50 included Hero Motocorp, Tata Steel, JSW Steel and M&M. Tata Motors recently made several corporate announcements. On September 3, 2025, the company announced a virtual group meeting of analysts and institutional investors scheduled for September 12, 2025, at 6:30 p.m. (IST). Earlier, on September 1, 2025, Tata Motors released a statement by Jaguar Land Rover Automotive, Plc, UK (JLR) regarding an IT security incident at JLR. On the same day, the company issued a press release titled ''Tata Motors Monthly Sales - August 2025''. Tata Motors has a history of rewarding its investors with dividends. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 6 per share on May 13, 2025, which was paid out on June 4, 2025. In addition, the company announced a split with new face value of Rs. 2 from old face value of Rs 10 on September 12, 2011. title: Honeywell Automation shares rise 2.06% on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Honeywell Automation gained 2.06% to trade at Rs 36,130 on Monday. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, Honeywell Automation's standalone revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,183 Crore. The company reported other income of Rs 41 Crore and total income of Rs 1,224 Crore for the same period. Total expenditure for the quarter was Rs 1,055 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 169 Crore. The company's interest came in at Rs 1 Crore and tax at Rs 43 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 124 Crore. The standalone revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 1,114 Crore, compared to Rs 1,090 Crore for December 2024, Rs 1,023 Crore for September 2024, and Rs 960 Crore for June 2024. Honeywell Automation's standalone annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 4,189 Crore. Other income stood at Rs 182 Crore, bringing the total income to Rs 4,371 Crore. Total expenditure amounted to Rs 3,659 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 712 Crore. Interest paid was Rs 6 Crore and tax was Rs 182 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 523 Crore. The standalone annual revenue for the year-ending March 2024 was Rs 4,058 Crore, compared to Rs 3,447 Crore for March 2023, Rs 2,948 Crore for March 2022 and Rs 3,042 Crore for March 2021. Key financial metrics include Basic Earnings Per Share (EPS) and Diluted EPS, both reported at Rs 592.15 for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 567.13 in March 2024, Rs 495.40 in March 2023, Rs 383.57 in March 2022 and Rs 520.32 in March 2021. The Book Value per share was Rs 4,588.86 for March 2025, up from Rs 4,097.95 the previous year. Margin ratios for the year-ending March 2025, show a Gross Profit Margin of 18.30%, Operating Margin of 17.00%, and Net Profit Margin of 12.49%. Return Ratios include a Return on Networth/Equity of 12.96%, a ROCE of 17.17%, and a Return on Assets of 9.34% for the same period. Liquidity Ratios for the year-ending March 2025, show a Current Ratio of 3.57 and a Quick Ratio of 3.41. Leverage Ratios indicate a Debt to Equity ratio of 0.00 and an Interest Coverage Ratio of 114.43. Growth ratios show a 3-year CAGR for Sales at 19.21% and a 3-year CAGR for Net Profit at 24.26% for the year-ending March 2025. Valuation ratios reveal a P/E ratio of 56.88, a P/B ratio of 7.33, an EV/EBITDA of 34.32 and a P/S ratio of 7.07 for the year-ending March 2025. Regarding corporate actions, the company announced a final dividend of Rs 105 per share on May 13, 2025, with the effect from June 16, 2025. This followed a dividend of Rs 100 per share announced on May 15, 2024. A Moneycontrol analysis from September 1, 2025, suggests a bullish outlook on the stock. With the stock last traded at Rs 36,130, Honeywell Automation has shown a positive movement in today's session.

With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3,028.00, Endurance Technologies showcases a positive trend in today's session.

title: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation shares rise 2.10% in morning trade
content: Shares of Hindustan Petroleum Corporation gained 2.10% in Monday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 391.65. The stock is experiencing upward movement. Hindustan Petroleum Corporation is part of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Hindustan Petroleum Corporation's financial performance shows a mix of results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 110,825.33 Crore, compared to Rs 109,632.80 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 113,888.28 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 4,222.21 Crore, up from Rs 3,066.59 Crore in the previous quarter and Rs 245.86 Crore in the same quarter last year. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 19.32, compared to Rs 16.06 in the previous quarter and Rs 2.98 in the same quarter of the previous year. The company's consolidated annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 434,106.17 Crore, slightly higher than the Rs 433,856.51 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 6,855.29 Crore, down from Rs 14,206.63 Crore in the previous year. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 31.66, compared to Rs 112.89 in the previous year. title: Bharat Forge shares surge 5.82% amid volume surge; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Bharat Forge shares jumped 5.82% to Rs 1,202.80 in Monday's session, experiencing high trading volume. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. At 11:16 am, the stock showed significant upward movement, reflecting positive investor interest. Bharat Forge is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index.
